uk.nhs.interoperability.transport

Interface ITKTransportProperties

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ITKTransportPropertiesImpl

    public interface ITKTransportProperties
    Container for transport properties associated with the ITKMessage.

    The transport properties represented here have been drived from the useful set of properties from <soap/> however they should be abstract enough to represent for different transports such as TMS and DTS
    Since:
    0.1
    Author:
    Michael Odling-Smee, Nicholas Jones
    See Also:
    ITKMessageProperties, ITKMessage

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getInvokedUrl()
      Gets the URL of the invoked service or transport hop.

      For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:To/>
      String getTransportAction()
      Gets the transportAction for the associated ITKMessage.

      For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:Action/>
      String getTransportFaultTo()
      Gets the transport address property that allows asynchronous transport layer faults to be returned.

      For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:FaultTo/>

      Note if the transport does not support a distinct faultTo property this should return the same as getTransportReplyTo() property or failing that the getTransportFrom()
      ITKTransportRoute getTransportFaultToRoute()
      Convenience method to return a fully constructed ITKTransportRoute for returning asynchronous faults to.
      String getTransportFrom()
      Gets the transport from address property - this may be used to return asynchronous responses to the originator.

      For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:From/>.
      String getTransportMessageId()
      Gets the unique transport level identifier for the associated message.
      String getTransportRelatesTo()
      Gets the transport relates to property that allows asynchronous transport layer messages to be correlated with their associated requests.

      For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:RelatesTo/>.
      String getTransportReplyTo()
      Gets the transport address property that allows asynchronous transport layer responses to be returned.

      For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:ReplyTo/>.

      Note if the transport does not support a distinct replyTo property this should return the same as the getTransportFrom()

    • Method Detail

      • setTransportMessageId

        @Requirement(traceTo="WS-ADR-01",
             status="abstract")
void setTransportMessageId(String transportMessageId)
        Sets the unique transport level identifier for the associated message. Typically this identifier is not know by, or preserved by application layer components and is often only pertinent to an individual transport hop (for example ITK WS-ADR-01 says every hop/WS invocation should use a new <wsa:MessageID/>).
        Parameters:
        transportMessageId -

      • getTransportMessageId

        @Requirement(traceTo="WS-ADR-01",
             status="abstract")
String getTransportMessageId()
        Gets the unique transport level identifier for the associated message. Typically this identifier is not know by, or preserved by application layer components and is often only pertinent to an individual transport hop (for example ITK WS-ADR-01 says every hop/WS invocation should use a new <wsa:MessageID/>).
        Returns:
        the transportMessageId for the transport hop

      • setInvokedUrl

        void setInvokedUrl(String invokedUrl)
        Sets the URL of the invoked service or transport hop.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:To/>
        Parameters:
        invokedUrl - The URL of the transport hop destination

      • setTransportAction

        void setTransportAction(String transportAction)
        Sets the transportAction for the associated ITKMessage.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:Action/>
        Parameters:
        transportAction - The transport action - e.g. urn:nhs-itk:services:201005:transferPatient-v1-0

      • getTransportAction

        String getTransportAction()
        Gets the transportAction for the associated ITKMessage.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:Action/>
        Returns:
        The transport action - e.g. urn:nhs-itk:services:201005:transferPatient-v1-0

      • setTransportFaultTo

        void setTransportFaultTo(String transportFaultTo)
        Sets the transport address property that allows asynchronous transport layer faults to be returned.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:FaultTo/>.

        Note if the transport does not support a distinct faultTo property this should be set to the same as setTransportReplyTo(String) property or failing that the setTransportFrom(String)
        Parameters:
        transportFaultTo - The transport fault to address - e.g. http://myserver.com/faulthandler

      • getTransportFaultTo

        String getTransportFaultTo()
        Gets the transport address property that allows asynchronous transport layer faults to be returned.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:FaultTo/>

        Note if the transport does not support a distinct faultTo property this should return the same as getTransportReplyTo() property or failing that the getTransportFrom()
        Returns:
        The transport fault to address - e.g. http://myserver.com/faulthandler

      • setTransportReplyTo

        void setTransportReplyTo(String transportReplyTo)
        Sets the transport address property that allows asynchronous transport layer responses to be returned.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:ReplyTo/>.

        Note if the transport does not support a distinct replyTo property this should be set to the same as the setTransportFrom(String)
        Parameters:
        transportReplyTo - The transport reply to address - e.g. http://myserver.com/responsehandler

      • getTransportReplyTo

        String getTransportReplyTo()
        Gets the transport address property that allows asynchronous transport layer responses to be returned.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:ReplyTo/>.

        Note if the transport does not support a distinct replyTo property this should return the same as the getTransportFrom()
        Returns:
        The transport reply to address - e.g. http://myserver.com/responsehandler

      • setTransportRelatesTo

        void setTransportRelatesTo(String transportRelatesTo)
        Sets the transport relates to property that allows asynchronous transport layer messages to be correlated with their associated requests.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:RelatesTo/>.

        Parameters:
        transportRelatesTo - The message id of the message to which this relates. For request messages this should be null

      • getTransportRelatesTo

        String getTransportRelatesTo()
        Gets the transport relates to property that allows asynchronous transport layer messages to be correlated with their associated requests.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:RelatesTo/>.

        Returns:
        The message id of the message to which this relates. For request messages this will return null

      • setTransportTo

        void setTransportTo(String transportTo)
        Sets the transport hop destination. Typically (at least for SOAP) this may be equivalent to setInvokedUrl(String)
        Parameters:
        transportTo - The destination system address

      • getTransportTo

        String getTransportTo()
        Gets the transport hop destination. Typically (at least for SOAP) this may be equivalent to getInvokedUrl()
        Returns:
        The destination system address

      • setTransportFrom

        void setTransportFrom(String transportFrom)
        Sets the transport from address property - this may be used to return asynchronous responses to the originator.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:From/>.

        Parameters:
        transportFrom - The address of the message originator

      • getTransportFrom

        String getTransportFrom()
        Gets the transport from address property - this may be used to return asynchronous responses to the originator.

        For SOAP this is mapped to/from <wsa:From/>.

        Returns:
        The address of the message originator

      • setTransportType

        void setTransportType(String transportType)
        Sets the transport type associated with this transport hop
        Parameters:
        transportType - The transportType. Can be one of ITKTransportRoute.DTS; ITKTransportRoute.HTTP_WS; ITKTransportRoute.SPINE_TMS or ITKTransportRoute.UNKNOWN

      • getTransportReplyToRoute

        ITKTransportRoute getTransportReplyToRoute()
        Convenience method to return a fully constructed ITKTransportRoute for returning asynchronous response messages to.
        Returns:
        A fully constructed ITKTransportRoute or null if there is no getTransportReplyTo() address specified.

      • getTransportFaultToRoute

        ITKTransportRoute getTransportFaultToRoute()
        Convenience method to return a fully constructed ITKTransportRoute for returning asynchronous faults to.
        Returns:
        A fully constructed ITKTransportRoute or null if there is no getTransportFaultTo() address specified.
